text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the determination of whether the drunk driver's actions were an intervening cause is partially dependent on how long the chair was in the road prior to the swerving (to determine whether the drunk driver could reasonably have seen the chair in time to avoid it without swerving). The candidate answer discusses foreseeability and proportionality of the swerving but never explicitly links the time the chair was present to the assessment of whether the swerving itself was a 'daft' or unforeseeable act, which is the core of the required point.", "criterion_id": "53430ddb-2da1-464a-af19-ff799ad6064e"}
